definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: Which techniques and tricks have you used to get ahead in your own career?
sentences.chinese: 你運用過什麼技巧和妙招來取得事業上的成功呢？

sentences.english: The sort who drew sneers about feminism .
sentences.chinese: 那種給女權運動招來譏嘲的人。

sentences.english: Speak the truth always, even if it leads to your death.
sentences.chinese: 不打誑語，即使實話實說會招來殺身之禍。

sentences.english: They brought it down upon themselves by killing so many cattle.
sentences.chinese: 這是他們殺了那麼多牛招來的報應。

sentences.english: This time, though, the 11-year-old may have unleashed a greater controversy.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這一次11歲的瑪麗亞似乎會招來更多的爭議。

sentences.english: The policeman was now blowing his whistle, and that sound brought other constables.
sentences.chinese: 那個警察於是吹哨子，哨音招來了其他警察。

sentences.english: But Shi's successes have also drawn criticism.
sentences.chinese: 但是，釋永信的成功也爲他招來批評。

sentences.english: But even that could have negative repurcussions.
sentences.chinese: 但即便這樣也會招來負面迴應。

sentences.english: He was unable to think up a new trick and went away.
sentences.chinese: 他無法再想出新的花招來，就訕訕地溜走了。

sentences.english: And beauty slandered with a bastard shame.
sentences.chinese: 於是美便招來了侮辱和誹謗。

sentences.english: Her actions drew criticism from her superior.
sentences.chinese: 她的行動招來上司的批評。

sentences.english: The dance emote got a ton of laughs.
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈動作招來了一場大笑。

sentences.english: Some pessimist think that this can only lead to humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 有些悲觀主義者認爲這隻會招來羞辱。

sentences.english: Smoothly to provoke a taxi fled the studio is still in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 順手招來一輛出租車往伊尚畫室駛去。

sentences.english: We believe our price is competitive enough to induce business.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信我們的價格不遜於別家，是可招來業務的。

sentences.english: Two people have been afraid the police, fearing reprisals bring greater SONG Huai.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人一直不敢報警，怕招來宋懷更大的報復。
